issuetype.description: In an agile development environment, code quality is intertwined into iterative development approach. Tech Debts are created when the team consciously takes a decision to ship out the code first due to real time project constraints and agree to refactor later. Tech Debts are used to prioritize speedy delivery over perfect code. Tech Debts DO NOT allow space for intentionally developing sub-standard code.
issuetype.name: TechDebt

content.text: FormSteps.cs includes a reference to FluentAssertions, but this library should not be in use as we are using Microsoft Unit Testing library for this purpose in NIRMS tests. This reference needs to be removed and any affected bindings updated to use the correct library.

issuetype.description: A collection of related bugs, stories, and tasks.
issuetype.name: Epic

fields.summary: Execute automated tests conditionally based on environment feature flag values

content.text: The validation pipeline should cover tests where feature flags are both enabled and disabled. The fastest way to do this while avoiding concurrency issues is to execute two passes of the test jobs. The first set of jobs should execute all tests plus the tests that are dependent on feature flags that match with the environment’s currently set feature flag values (handled by
). After this run, we should flip the feature flag values in the pipeline and execute a second pass of the test jobs that will run the remaining tests.
Write the PowerShell to flip feature flag values
Write a pipeline step template to execute the PowerShell
Update the validation pipelines (trade.plants, trade.pts, trade.remos) to:
Execute a job that calls the step template above
Execute the test jobs again (filtered by only tests that have a feature flag trait)
The PowerShell/step template to flip feature flags should be configured with a whitelist of solutions and (if necessary) a blacklist of environment variable to exclude

content.text: At the point of determining the final outcome for a GB Spot check, an automated email will be sent. Below are the final outcomes of a GB Spot Check
These emails will be sent to both the trader and the establishment (where there is an email present).
send an email of the final GB Spot Check outcome
the trader and/or establishment are informed of the spot check outcome
Upon marking the task as 'Mark Complete” send automated emails depending on the outcome selected (defined above)
To include the guidance described in the Satisfactory + Guidance free text field
To include the guidance described in the Unsatisfactory + Reason free text field
AC1: GB Spot Check emails to be sent to both Trader and Establishment emails
I am on the GB Spot Check form
I select an outcome (Satisfactory, Satisfactory, Guidance Sent, Unsatisfactory, Reasons)
mark the spot check as complete
the email is sent to both trader and establishment (where there is an email address for the establishment):
the emails to be addressed to:
AC2: Send Email to Applicant when Satisfactory outcome is recorded:
I am on the GB Spot Check form
the final outcome of the GB Spot Check is “Satisfactory”
when the task has been ‘Mark Complete’
Successful GB Spot Check' email content
will be automatically sent to the Trader and the Establishment where the email address is present
the email will be sent from the “NI Retail Movement Scheme” mailbox (
AC3: Emails Display in Timeline on the GB Spot Check record:
a GB Spot Check has the outcome “Satisfactory”
Successful GB Spot Check' email content
will be automatically sent to the Trader and the Establishment where the email address is present
this email will be displayed in the timeline on the GB Spot Check record
AC4: Send Email to Applicant when Satisfactory + Guidance outcome is recorded:
a GB Spot check has been triggered in IDCOMS
the final outcome of the GB Spot Check is “Satisfactory + Guidance”
when the task has been ‘Mark Complete’
'Satisfactory + Guidance GB Spot Check' email content
will be automatically sent to the Trader and the Establishment where the email address is present
the guidance reasons (from the free text description box) will be populated in the email
the email will be sent from the “NI Retail Movement Scheme” mailbox (
AC5: Populate Guidance from the record into the email
a GB Spot check has been triggered in IDCOMS
the final outcome of the GB Spot Check is “Satisfactory + Guidance”
I populate the multi-lined text box with the reasons per line
when the task has been ‘Mark Complete’
this will be populated in the email as bullet points as per the email template content
the email will be sent from the “NI Retail Movement Scheme” mailbox (
AC6: Emails Display in Timeline on the GB Spot Check record:
a GB Spot Check has the outcome “Satisfactory + Guidance”
'Satisfactory + Guidance GB Spot Check' email content
will be automatically sent to the Applicant and the Establishment where the email address is present
this email will be displayed in the timeline
AC7: Send Email to Applicant when Unsatisfactory + Reason outcome is recorded:
a GB Spot check has been triggered in IDCOMS
the final outcome of the GB Spot Check is “Unsatisfactory + Reason”
when the task has been ‘Mark Complete’
'Unsatisfactory + Reason GB Spot Check' email content
will be automatically sent to the Trader and the Establishment where the email address is present
the unsatisfactory reasons (from the free text description box) will be populated in the email
the email will be sent from the “NI Retail Movement Scheme” mailbox (
AC8: Populate Unsatisfactory Reason from the record into the email
a GB Spot check has been triggered in IDCOMS
the final outcome of the GB Spot Check is “Unsatisfactory + Reason”
I populate the multi-lined text box with the reasons per line
when the task has been ‘Mark Complete’
this will be populated in the email as bullet points as per the email template content
the email will be sent from the “NI Retail Movement Scheme” mailbox (
AC9: Emails Display in Timeline on the GB Spot Check record:
a GB Spot Check has the outcome “Unsatisfactory + Reason”
will be automatically sent to the Applicant and the Establishment where the email address is present
this email will be displayed in the timeline
Logic to create and populate emails via flow
Ensure colour formatting on the links are added to the emails.

content.text: Various forms within the remos solution have only the System Administrator and System Customiser roles associated with them. This is fine while the relevant forms remain the fallback form of choice, but if this changes then the user experience might be affected.
All forms in the NIRMS solution should be reviewed and the base role added where missing.

The enums will be 179640000 and 179640001 - they default to the publisher number (17964 for rms) and then just starts at 0000 and works its way up.
Therefore assume 179640000 for Pass, 179640001 for Fail,
to be confirmed once the field and option set has been created - FYI
